welcomeScreen1Title: Thank you for downloading this app!
welcomeScreen1Text: Building a good habit is difficult. This app is built on scientific findings that could help with forming a habit
welcomeScreen2Title: How to form a strong habit?
welcomeScreen2Text:
A reliable way of creating a habit is to do the habit in response to something you already do regularly. This is known as a trigger event, or simply, a trigger.

For example, getting into your car is a trigger for you to put on the seatbelt.

If we can train ourselves to do the habit in response to a trigger, we can achieve a more frequent repetition of the action.
welcomeScreen3Title: How to choose a good trigger?
welcomeScreen3Text:
Not every action you are already doing would make a good trigger. The best triggers are those that you do every day, regardless of whether it is a weekend or weekday, whether it is at home or on holiday.

For example, having dinner would be a reliable trigger since you do it every day
welcomeScreen4Text:
The app lets you add implementation intentions to your habits. Think of them as steps you need to do in order to complete the habit.

For example, the 'Go to the gym' habit could have the following intentions: take a bus to the sports centre, walk into the gym, start by doing 10 pull ups.

It is important to be precise in your habit intentions.
welcomeScreen5Text: You are now ready to start using the app. Use the app as a tool to achieve your habit goals. But remember that no app could ever do your habits for you
startWithSamplesMessage: Would you like to start with example habits and triggers so you can better understand how the app works?
triggersScreenTip: Triggers are actions that you already do regularly. Linking a desired habit to a behaviour you already do inreases your chance of regularly repeating your habit
addTriggerScreenTip: Providing an approximate daily time interval in which your trigger event occurs lets the app remind you when you should complete your habit
triggerNameInputExample: eg. Starting dinner, leaving for home after work
startBeforeEndMessage: Start time must be before end time
intentionTextExample: eg. take a bus to the gym
updateAndMakeActive: Update habit and make it active
noTimedTriggerInfoBox: Watch out for habits in this list since the app cannot remind you about them
messageNoteOnAbsentTimedTriggers: These habits are linked to a trigger that does not have an estimated time interval. This means that the app cannot remind you about these habits.
noIntentionNotificationMessage: Turning this setting off means that you will not receive any information about implementation intentions, when you are reminded about a habit
noIntentionNotificationBody: Remember to complete this habit today
noUpcomingHabitsMessage: No upcoming habits for the rest of the day
